This code chunk is part of the `ShadowPlacer` class initialization process. It sets up the necessary components for detecting collisions with the ground using a downward-pointing ray (CollisionRay). The code initializes the collision traverser (`cTrav`), creates a ray node to detect floor collisions, and configures a `CollisionHandlerFloor` to handle these collisions, ensuring that the shadow remains on the ground.

if not cTrav:
            # set up the shadow collision traverser
            base.initShadowTrav()
            cTrav = base.shadowTrav

        self.cTrav = cTrav
        self.shadowNodePath = shadowNodePath

        floorOffset = 0.025
        # Set up the collison ray
        # This is a ray cast down to detect floor polygons
        self.cRay = CollisionRay(0.0, 0.0, CollisionHandlerRayStart, 0.0, 0.0, -1.0)
        cRayNode = CollisionNode('shadowPlacer')
        cRayNode.addSolid(self.cRay)
        self.cRayNodePath = NodePath(cRayNode)
        self.cRayBitMask = floorCollideMask
        cRayNode.setFromCollideMask(self.cRayBitMask)
        cRayNode.setIntoCollideMask(BitMask32.allOff())

        # set up floor collision mechanism
        self.lifter = CollisionHandlerFloor()
        #self.lifter.setInPattern("on-floor")
        #self.lifter.setOutPattern("off-floor")
        self.lifter.setOffset(floorOffset)
        self.lifter.setReach(4.0)
